ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take it, a good learning experience
Take it to fulfill your senior MCDB BS research requirement.
Best way to get your own research experience. 5 page grant style paper at the end of the fall semester that will conclude with a presentation and 15 page thesis research article in the spring.
If you want to do research for credit and need it for your major then definitely take this class!
I would recommend getting credit for research.
I would recommend this course for MCDB seniors.
MCDB 485 is an independent research course that allows you to experience first hand research in the lab and research area of your choosing.
A must take for the BS requirement for MCDB

MCDB 485 is basically self-directed research for credit. During the fall semester, the only assignments you will have to turn in for the course itself are a short research proposal at the beginning of the term and a slightly longer grant proposal (5 pages) at the end of the term. Everything else is basically up to you and your PI, so take care to ensure that you enjoy your research project and the people with whom you are working.
